summary: Diff implements extended user profiles (bio + avatar config) with backend APIs, adds backend-stored user preferences (theme + polling interval) with frontend Settings/Profile dialogs, and introduces a migration module wired into backend upgrades. Potential spec mismatches: theme enum uses `systemDefault` (vs required `system`) and polling interval is stored in milliseconds (vs required seconds).

missing_requirements.requirement: Settings include a theme preference with allowed values: light, dark, system.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend and frontend types use `#systemDefault` / `ThemePreference.systemDefault` rather than an allowed value literally named `system` as specified.

missing_requirements.requirement: Settings include a message polling interval preference (in seconds) that is used by the frontend to control how frequently messages refetch for the selected room.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend preference field is `pollingIntervalMs` (milliseconds) and frontend converts secondsâ†”milliseconds. This does not match the requirement wording/AC that the preference be stored 'in seconds'.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed global visual theme styling (warm terracotta/amber palette) via CSS/Tailwind configuration.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on profile customization and in-app settings; no requirement requests a theme/palette redesign or Tailwind token changes beyond adding a user theme preference.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a first-login ProfileSetupDialog to force/create a profile on initial authentication.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-9 asks for a profile editing UI accessible within the app, but does not request a separate mandatory setup flow/dialog for new users.
